3,50 mojitos and (frozen) margaritas... that's the main draw.  while the mojitos weren't the best (the mint was looking tired and old), they were still pretty tasty, and quite cheap.  Of the margaritas, my friend tried the regular, passionfruit (her favorite), and strawberry (her least favorite).  if you want a margarita rocks, it's an extra 2 euros.  the hard shell tacos looked decent (i didn't have any).  I forgot what my group said about the quesadillas, but the pico de gallo that accompanied the quesadilla was good, and one of the salsas was actually a bit spicy (translation - if you're a spaniard, this would be very hot... to me, it was barely a tingle).  Apparently this is the sister location to Rosa de Raval, and it gets packed.  The decor was playful and fun, and the music was lively.  It's a good choice for a place to hang out with friends and drink for cheap.  the food was pricy for mexican, but seeing that I have yet to find good mexican for cheap here, i guess this place is decent.
